alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 22 at 10:37PM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW LIKELY BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low will move into the gulf Thursday with an associated front moving over the panhandle Friday morning. Precipitation will begin in the Yakutat area before spreading from north to south across the panhandle. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals and, particularly in the south, the transition from snow to rain. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alaska, including the inner channels and central and southern outer coast. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Greatest snowfall rates expected Friday afternoon into the overnight hours for the northern panhandle. Greatest snowfall rates for the southern panhandle expected early Saturday morning. Mixing with rain along the outer coast likely Friday evening.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
